intro: Walwhalleya, commonly known as the "whalleyan lily," is a genus of flowering plants native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related species. Walwhalleya species typically grow in coastal and sandy environments, adapting well to arid conditions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
